SAP Functional Consultant- (Spending Chain Reimbursables)
description:

Our 13,000+ people are united in a shared purpose to pursue the limitless potential of technology and ingenuity for clients across defense, national security, public safety, civilian, and military health organizations.
Join Accenture Federal Services to do the work you love in an inclusive, collaborative, and caring community, where you can be empowered to grow, learn and thrive through hands-on experience, certifications, industry training and more.
Join us to drive positive, lasting change that moves missions and the government forward!
Organization: Accenture Federal Services
Location: Hybrid
We are:
 
Accenture Federal Services, bringing together commercial innovation with the latest technology to unleash the potential for our federal clients. Operating in the nation's Capital, we stay ahead of what's coming next. Join us where ideas are freely exchanged, and concepts evolve into practical solutions. 
You are:
 
SAP Functional Consultant- (Spending Chain Reimbursables)
Responsibilities include:
- Maintaining, enhancing and or developing work of SAP modules and those that interface with other applications
- Creating functional solution and completing design, build, and test
- Developing detailed Business process design designs and associated documentation
- Designing and documenting RICEFW objects, test models and scripts, etc.
- Lead efforts to gathering requirements and design solutions to meet these Business process designs requirements
- Facilitate interaction with technical counterparts to ensure technical solutions meet all functional requirements
- Developing test strategies and managing large complex test efforts
- Developing detailed configuration rationales and designs as well as system configuration build
- Experience with budgeting, staffing, forecasting and work planning
- Manage a team, including mentoring and training junior team members
- Manage and supported SAP EDI/IDOCs
- Knowledge of Funds allocation in the procurement
Here's what you need:
- 1-3 years SAP Procurement ECC and SRM experience.
- Federal-specific requirements to include one or more of the following: SAP procurement for public sector
The extra's:
- US Citizenship, no dual citizenship
- Security clearance: Clearable up to Secret
Bonus points:
- SAP S/4 experience
- Experience with the following SAP modules: Materials Management (MM), Inventory Management/Warehouse Management (IMWM)
- Experience writing and executing test plans

At Accenture Federal Services, nothing matters more than helping the US federal government make the nation stronger and safer and life better for people. Our 13,000+ people are united in a shared purpose to pursue the limitless potential of technology and ingenuity for clients across defense, national security, public safety, civilian, and military health organizations.
Join Accenture Federal Services to do the work you love in an inclusive, collaborative, and caring community, where you can be empowered to grow, learn and thrive through hands-on experience, certifications, industry training and more.
Join us to drive positive, lasting change that moves missions and the government forward!
Organization: Accenture Federal Services
Location: Hybrid
We are:
 
Accenture Federal Services, bringing together commercial innovation with the latest technology to unleash the potential for our federal clients. Operating in the nation's Capital, we stay ahead of what's coming next. Drawing from the power of Accenture, we deliver integrated, mobile, and interactive experiences that exceed our people's expectations. Join us where ideas are freely exchanged, and concepts evolve into practical solutions. 
You are:
 
SAP Functional Consultant- (Spending Chain Reimbursables)
Responsibilities include:
- Maintaining, enhancing and or developing work of SAP modules and those that interface with other applications
- Creating functional solution and completing design, build, and test
- Developing detailed Business process design designs and associated documentation
- Designing and documenting RICEFW objects, test models and scripts, etc.
- Lead efforts to gathering requirements and design solutions to meet these Business process designs requirements
- Facilitate interaction with technical counterparts to ensure technical solutions meet all functional requirements
- Developing test strategies and managing large complex test efforts
- Developing detailed configuration rationales and designs as well as system configuration build
- Experience with budgeting, staffing, forecasting and work planning
- Manage a team, including mentoring and training junior team members
- Manage and supported SAP EDI/IDOCs
- Knowledge of Funds allocation in the procurement
Here's what you need:
- 1-3 years SAP Procurement ECC and SRM experience.
- Federal-specific requirements to include one or more of the following: SAP procurement for public sector
The extra's:
- US Citizenship, no dual citizenship
- Security clearance: Clearable up to Secret
Bonus points:
- SAP S/4 experience
- Experience with the following SAP modules: Materials Management (MM), Inventory Management/Warehouse Management (IMWM)
- Experience writing and executing test plans
